description:
[Barbara](https://profile.intra.42.fr/users/astehl) want to invite everyone to another fun Game Night with Board-/Card- and Dice-Games! 

If someone wants to look at Barbara's collection, you can find it here: https://boardgamegeek.com/collection/user/MoriaProfa?own=1&subtype=boardgame&ff=1 

On the top on the left there is the possibility to get a Large Gallery Mode thats recommended to use. Most of the titles are German, but many of the games are also playable without any knowledge of German (except for those with much text). You are very welcomed to message Barbara on Discord if you have any questions about a special game, if she should check one for playability without knowing German and/or of course if you wish to play it so she should bring it! Lets have some (more) fun together!
name: Game Night: Board-/Card-/Dice-Games üé≤

description:
[Anvita](https://profile.intra.42.fr/users/anpatil) wants to teach you to make your own bracelets using the art of Macram√©. 

We will start with Chevron, and the basic knots and directions. Choose your own colour combinations of embroidery thread (will be provided), and once you learn the basics you'll be able to make any design of your choosing! Visit braceletbook.com to get an idea. Join the workshop for sure to learn how to read the patterns on braceletbook. ;)
name: Macram√© Bracelet Making

description:
[MT](https://profile.intra.42.fr/users/mnowotny) is inviting you to play a fun creative game together. 

Every participant receives a piece of paper and a felt tip pen in a specific colour. Every two or five minutes (whatever we'll prefer), you pass your paper to your left neighbour. We'll create art together and decide afterwards if we want to display our pieces or take them home. :) In the latter case, we'll hold a little auction to decide who can take which piece home.

description:
Are you ready to take your coding skills to new heights‚Äîliterally? 

Code to the Top is a unique challenge for all 42 students who dare to push limits not just in code, but in altitude. The goal is simple:

üóª Who can code a 42 project at the highest elevation on Earth?

### Rules:
- You must not be alone. At least two people must be physically present at the location where the coding takes place.
- You must provide photo evidence and post it in the official [42 Vienna Slack channel](https://42born2code.slack.com/archives/C05U1PGPQ4V). 
- The photo must clearly show the altitude (via GPS device, signage, or screen).
- It must also show a person actively coding on a laptop at that location.

**Planes, cable cars, or any kind of aircraft or machine do not count. The spot must be fixed on land (mountain peaks, plateaus, etc.).** How you reach the location is up to you‚Äîhike, climb, bike, or teleport‚Äîjust get there and code.

The participant who codes at the highest documented altitude wins eternal glory (**and a cool surprise prize** üèÜ).

Ready to rise above the clouds and leave your mark? üßó‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

Code high, code proud.
name: Code to the Top ‚Äì The 42 Altitude Challenge

description:
As already briefly announced in week's 15 weekly newsletter, **from the 1st until the 3rd of July** we will be hosting a short bootcamp called "**Pro Training - AI / Machine Learning using advanced libraries**", the bootcamp lasts three days from **from 09.00 to 17.00**.

The bootcamp will take place in the [House of Digitalization](https://virtuelleshaus.at/en) in [Tulln](https://maps.app.goo.gl/zFoc89fpvDwMEcPSA), where members of WKNO will take part.

Unlike some previously proposed bootcamps, for this bootcamp, it is a necessary **requirement** to have **basic Python programming skills**.
**Theme**: This bootcamp aims to give attendees a practical application of basic machine learning concepts
- ***Details*:** 3 levels of difficulty
   - **Module 0xX**: Introduction to AI projects, like implementing a linear regression model to predict a continuous variable from input data
   - **Module 1xX**: Discovering classification through logistic regression and other more advanced models
   - **Module 2xX**: More advanced AI projects, such as constructing a neural network model for image classification
You will not have to do them all, but to "place yourself" on a level of difficulty based on your previous knowledge on the topic and start from there.
---
We are looking for **8** students who would be interested in participating as attendees, while helping the participants understand how the system and the peer-to-peer work.
Since the bootcamp will take place in Tulln:
- depending on how many cars we have: you could come with us but, if we do not have enough cars/places, than we will buy the train tickets for you,
- and you will get food every day (First day: breakfast, lunch, and snacks - Second and Third day: lunch - Beverages and coffee during the whole training).

Please, register only if you plan to fully attend the 3 days, already have basic Python knowledge, and are willing to help. - Deadline for the registration: Fri 20 June 2025.
_Just to be clear, please note that: no blackhole days will be added to your account if you attend, and no extension will be done to any deadline. Your presence is required all 3 days from 09.00 to 17.00._
name: Pro Training - AI / Machine Learning using advanced libraries
